borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>On account of its scale and siting&nbsp;within a rear garden setting, the proposed development is at odds with the surrounding pattern of development and results in harm to neighbouring occupiers through the&nbsp;additional generation of noise, waste, smoke, fumes and comings and goings.&nbsp;The development would therefore constitute&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="unneighbourly" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0ke344usir6h42">unneighbourly</span>&nbsp;development and is contrary to: -National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="NPPF" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0ke33x8grdt8d5">NPPF</span>) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0ke32ja7dozdb0">DLUHC</span>, 2021); - Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp; - Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp; - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);&nbsp; - Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); - The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p><br></p>

<p>The principle of introducing a self-contained outbuilding of&nbsp;primary residential use within the garden setting of no.4 is not supported. The proposal therefore represents an&nbsp;inappropriate and uncharacteristic residential form in a rear garden setting&nbsp;which results in harm to the occupiers of the main dwelling at no.4. As such, the proposal is contrary to:&nbsp; -National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="MHCLG" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lhz0kdr4bpyd8g0s5">MHCLG</span>, February 2019); -Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);&nbsp;Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);- Policies SP2,&nbsp; SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation Version, October 2020); - The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>

<p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">The applicant has failed to
present plans which accurately portray the development present at the
application site. Specifically the plans represent conflicting development, with an existing single <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="storey" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="li31l5cwwj19mlivm" style="">storey</span> rear conservatory&nbsp;to the main <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="li31l5cw11xw59dgf" style="">dwellinghouse&nbsp;</span>indicated on the Block Plan provided, but not shown on the Ground Floor Plans.&nbsp;The
proposal could prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment
on the application; the proposed development cannot be accurately assessed and
it cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan.
</p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">-&nbsp;National Planning
Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">- Policy D4 of the London Plan
(March 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">- Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local
Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of
the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan
Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">- The Residential Extensions
and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<o:p></o:p></p><p>











</p><p style="margin: 0cm; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6
of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan:
(Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<font color="#242424" face="Segoe UI, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
description: Retrospective planning permission for retention of single-storey rear outbuilding for use as a residential annexe.
